availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Rose (Warren County, Kentucky, attorney, commissioner of common schools, and county court clerk)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, attorney, commissioner of common schools, and county court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Charlotte Claypool Rose in Warren County, Kentucky, on October 24, 1854. Father of Martha Rose. Married to Elizabeth Moore Rose in Warren County on December 29, 1857. Attorney in Warren County in 1860. Commissioner of common schools in Warren County from 1861 to 1862. County court clerk in Warren County from 1862 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 807.
